sec.title: International Centre of Nursing Ethics (ICNE) News
sec.p: ICNE is based in the Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences at the University of Surrey, Guildford, United Kingdom. It enables those engaged in all aspects of nursing ethics – empirical and philosophical – across the globe to collaborate on research and scholarship. In addition to initiating and promoting international research, the centre also hosts an annual conference, regular ethics seminars and a postgraduate professional ethics summer school.

The ICNE and Deakin University, Centre for Quality and Patient Safety Research (QPS) cordially welcome you to contribute and participate in the 14th ICNE conference to be held on 16–17 May 2013 in Melbourne, Australia. The conference venue is the Carson Conference Centre, Australian Nursing Federation (Victorian Branch), Melbourne, Australia. The conference theme is ‘Ethical Issues at the End of Life: Practice and Policy Imperatives in Health Care’ addressed through plenary and concurrent oral presentations. sec.title: BioEdge
sec.p: BioEdge is edited by Michael Cook who is based in Melbourne, Australia, and provides regular updates and news regarding bioethics around the world.

sec.title: Global Health Ethics
sec.p: The Global Health Ethics website offers a virtual space for dialogue on shared ethical concerns and support on unique ethical dilemmas. This website is available in several languages.

sec.title: Amnesty International
sec.p: This website offers news, information and resources relating to health and human rights. Readers can sign up for the fortnightly electronic bulletin for health professionals and access links to related websites.

sec.title: The European Association of Centres of Medical Ethics (EACME)
sec.p: This website provides information about health-care ethics activities across Europe.

sec.title: ETHXWeb
sec.p: ETHXWeb is a searchable database of journal articles, book chapters, bills, laws, court decisions, reports, books, audiovisuals and news articles relating to bioethics and professional ethics. It is maintained by the National Reference Center for Bioethics Literature, Kennedy Institute of Ethics, Georgetown University.

sec.title: EthicShare
sec.p: EthicShare is a searchable database of articles; book chapters; US Government publications, including Presidential Commission reports; dissertation records; e-books and other scholarly resources relating to the field of bioethics. It is based at the University of Minnesota. For more information visit the following link:
